paper_title.ja: シリコン製サック一体型三薬弁の試作と補助人工心臓への応用(共著)
paper_title.en: Silicone Tri-leaflet Valve and Silicone Blood Chamber made en bloc for Ventricular Assit Device

description.ja: シリコン製の三葉弁とサックを一度に金型で形成し, 安価な人工弁一体型血液ポンプを製作することができたので補助人工心臓に応用する目的でその性能をテストした. 対照として25mmBjörk-Shiley monostrut弁(以下BSV)を用いた. 75mmHgの水圧を加えた逆方向の定圧もれ試験ではBSVに比べ低値であった. 弁前後の圧較差はBSVに比べやや大きくなった. 拍出流量は, 前負荷12mmHg, 後負荷120mmHgとし, 駆動陽圧160mmHg, 駆動陰圧20mmHg, % systole35%とした場合に, 80bpmで最大となり6.3L/minであった. 後負荷100mmHgの耐久性試験では54日間異常を認めなかった. 弁の圧較差を減らすことが必要とも思われたが, 補助人工心臓として流量及び耐久性の点では使用可能であると考えられた.
description.en: A blood chamber with a silicone lenticular sac and two silicone tri-leaflet valves made en bloc was manufactured using die caster for a ventricular assist device (VAD) that would be less expensive. Regurgitation of the silicone valve was measured 205ml/min, and that of Björk-Shiley monostrut valve was measured 321ml/min. Pressure gradient across the silicone valve was slightly greater than that across the monostrut valves. By this VAD, the maximam output flow of 6.3L/min was achieved at the rate of 80bpm in a Donovan type mock circulatory system, which was selected the preload of 12mmHg, the afterload of 120mmHg, the driving pressure of 160mmHg, the driving vacuum of 20mmHg and the percent systole 35%. The VAD worked well for 54 days in an overflow type mock circulatory system at the afterload of 100mmHg.

publication_name.en: Journal of the Japanese Society for Artificial Organs and Tissues

paper_title.ja: リニアモータ駆動型全人工心臓の駆動持性(共著)
paper_title.en: PERFORMANCE CHARACTERISTICS OF A LINEAR MOTOR-DRIVEN TOTAL ARTIFICIAL HEART

description.ja: 1993年に実施した急性動物実験で得られた経験に基づいて, リニアモータの推力向上と血液ポンプの流入口の径を大きくしたリニアモータ駆動型全人工心臓(リニアTAH)を試作した。模擬循環試験装置を用いてリニアTAHの効率を測定した結果, ポンプ拍動数120[bpm]において, 入力電力30、18[W], 機械出力2.03[W]であり, 効率は6.7%であった。リニアTAHの損失のうち, 鉄損が19.4[W]であった。羊を用いた急性動物実験において, ポンプ拍動数が85[bpm]の時, 量大左心ポンプ拍出量4.2[Llmin]が得られた。ポンプ拍動数60～100[bpm]の範囲内において, 左右流量差は0～9.1%であった。2時間の循環代行後のリニアモータの表面温度は49[℃]まで上昇した。
description.en: A linear motor-driven total artificial heart (linear TAH) was developed by the authors on basis of the experience of the acute animal experiment in 1993. The thrust of the linear motor, the shape of the blood pumps and the size of the Jellyfish valves have been improved in the new linear TAH. The efficiency of the linear TAR was measured in a mock circulatory testing system. The input power was 30.18 W, the mechanical output was 2.03 W and the efficiency was 6.7% at the pumping rate of 120bpm. The iron loss of the linear motor was 19.4 W in this testing. An acute animal experiment using a sheep was conducted to evaluate the hemodynamic performances. The maximum left pump flow rate was 4.2L/min at the pumping rate of 85bpm. The difference in flow rates was between 0 and 9.1% in the range from 60 to 100bpm. The temparature on the surface of the linear motor rose to 49°C after two hours from the beginning of the artificial circulation.

publication_name.en: Journal of the Japanese Society for Artificial Organs and Tissues

paper_title.en: Silicone tri-leaflet valve and silicone blood chamber made en bloc for ventricular assist device

The VAD worked well for 54 days in an overflow type mock circulatory system at the afterload of 100mmHg.

paper_title.ja: リニアモータ駆動型全人工心臓の駆動特性
paper_title.en: Performance characteristics of a linear motor-driven total artificial heart

description.ja: 1993年に実施した急性動物実験で得られた経験に基づいて, リニアモータの推力向上と血液ポンプの流入口の径を大きくしたリニアモータ駆動型全人工心臓(リニアTAH)を試作した。模擬循環試験装置を用いてリニアTAHの効率を測定した結果, ポンプ拍動数120[bpm]において, 入力電力30、18[W], 機械出力2.03[W]であり, 効率は6.7%であった。リニアTAHの損失のうち, 鉄損が19.4[W]であった。羊を用いた急性動物実験において, ポンプ拍動数が85[bpm]の時, 量大左心ポンプ拍出量4.2[Llmin]が得られた。ポンプ拍動数60～100[bpm]の範囲内において, 左右流量差は0～9.1%であった。2時間の循環代行後のリニアモータの表面温度は49[℃]まで上昇した。
description.en: A linear motor-driven total artificial heart (linear TAH) was developed by the authors on basis of the experience of the acute animal experiment in 1993. The thrust of the linear motor, the shape of the blood pumps and the size of the Jellyfish valves have been improved in the new linear TAH. The efficiency of the linear TAR was measured in a mock circulatory testing system. The input power was 30.18 W, the mechanical output was 2.03 W and the efficiency was 6.7% at the pumping rate of 120bpm. The iron loss of the linear motor was 19.4 W in this testing. An acute animal experiment using a sheep was conducted to evaluate the hemodynamic performances. The maximum left pump flow rate was 4.2L/min at the pumping rate of 85bpm. The temparature on the surface of the linear motor rose to 49°C after two hours from the beginning of the artificial circulation.

paper_title.en: Development of an intravascular punping oxygenator using a new silicone membrane
In vitro evaluation of linear motor-driven total artificial heart

description.en: This paper deals with the in vitro evaluation of a newly developed linear motor-driven total artificial heart (linear TAH). The linear TAHs have been developed and evaluated in mock testing and acute animal experiments. The new linear TAH was made based on experience with acute animal experiments. The maximum static thrust of the new linear pulse motor is 146 N with exciting current of 1.69 A. The weight and the volume of this linear TAH are 1.9 kg and 560 mi, respectively. The linear TAH has a kinetic thrust of 85 to 43 N and provides the maximum flow rate of 6.8 L/min in mock circulatory testing.

paper_title.en: Past, present, and future of total artificial heart development at Research Institute of Replacement Medicine, Hiroshima University School of Medicine

description.en: The history and recent progress in total artificial heart (TAH) development were reviewed and divided into three stages. The first stage was between 1966 and 1972, when a trial developing an artificial heart (AH) driver was begun using poppet valves. Fluid amplifiers and air operated valves were then employed as a controller. The second stage was between 1973 and 1983. Several models of pneumatic AH were manufactured and implanted into animals, and it was confirmed that animals could survive with their circulation supported by these mechanical hearts. The third stage was from 1984 to the present, and now a trial to construct a totally implantable type of AH is under way. On the basis of the experience of developing TAHs, the following points are discussed as future problems to be solved: first, the production of small yet powerful actuators; second, the establishment of safe and reliable controls and an energy supply method; third, the development of a durable blood chamber containing valves; and fourth, the acquisition of large research funds for TAH from governments and other granting agencies.
